abstract: The company insists the sites were not deactivated because of the Royal Wedding.
snippet: The company insists the sites were not deactivated because of the Royal Wedding.
lead_paragraph: Dozens of Facebook pages, including those run by student activists in London and across the United Kingdom were deactivated in the last 24 hours, prompting some of the students to wonder whether the mass suspension was intended to quash dissent during the Royal Wedding. But a Facebook spokesman dismissed politics or the Royal Wedding as a reason for the suspension of the pages.

headline.main: Facebook Deactivates Protest Pages in Britain
